title: Women in Islam
summary: The experiences of Muslim women (Arabic: مسلمات‎ Muslimāt, singular مسلمة Muslimah) vary widely between and within different societies.[2] At the same time, their adherence to Islam is a shared factor that affects their lives to a varying degree and gives them a common identity that may serve to bridge the wide cultural, social, and economic differences between them.[2][3]
